Name: sha ren
砂仁
Biological: Amomum villosum Lour.var. xanthioides T.L.Wu et Senjen (Amomum xanthioides) (綠殼砂)

Geography: mainly in Guangdong, Guangxi, Yunnan, Fujian provinces of China
Yingchun, Xinyi, Gaozhou counties of Guangdong province
In recent years: Guangxi, Yunnan, Fujian provinces also cultivated spring sha (陽春砂)
Maladies Treated: Damp-turbidity obstructing the middle jiao, epigastric distension with lack of appetite, abdominal pain and distension, stomach pain, nausea and vomiting, reduced appetite, cold diarrhea, dysentery, restless fetus due to qi mechanism not flowing smoothly
Medical Function: Anti-ulcer effect
Inhibits secretion of stomach acid
Promotes stomach and intestine movement
Anti-platelet coagulation
Effect on isolated intestine: Low concentration of decoction can stimulate, while high concentration can inhibit
Dosage: 3 to 6 g. Do not cook for long time. 3-6g。入湯劑，宜後下。
Samples of Formulae:
For flatulence and pain in stomach due to qi stagnation: sha ren (Fructus Amomi), zhi ke (Aurantii fructus), mu xiang (Saussurea root)

For vomiting due to qi stagnation: sha ren (Fructus Amomi), chen pi (Citrus peel), ban xia (Pinellia rhizome)

For diarrhea due to pixu (spleen deficient): sha ren (Fructus Amomi), gan jiang (dry ginger)

For calming fetus: sha ren (Fructus Amomi), bai zhu (Atractylodes macrocephala), sang ji sheng (Taxillus), xu duan (Dipsacus).

行氣開胃：用于氣滞之胃腹脹痛，可配枳 殼（Aurantii fructus），木 香（Saussurea root）； 用于嘔吐: 配陳皮（Citrus peel），半夏（Pinellia rhizome）。 脾虛泄 瀉:常配乾姜（dry ginger）。 順氣安胎：用於氣機不暢所引起的胎動不安，常配白朮（Atractylodes macrocephala），桑寄生（Taxillus），續 斷（Dipsacus）。
Contraindications: Not to use in cases of yinxu (yin deficient) with heat. 陰虛有熱者忌用。
Notes: Sha ke (砂殼) is the shell of sha ren (Fructus Amomi). It can help with digestion but lacks the warming effect of sha ren. It is more suitable for weak stomach with over active liver.

Name: da zao
hong zao
Biological: Ziziphus jujuba Mill. var. inermis Bge.

Geography: Mainly distributed in Henan, Shandong, Shanxi, Shaanxi, Sichuan, Guizhou provinces; mainly produced in Shandong and Henan; principal production in Henan Xinzhen, Lingbao; Shandong Yanggu, Linqing, Renping, Tai'an, and other regions
Maladies Treated: Weakness, shortness of breath, lassitude, lack of appetite, loose stools due to pixu (spleen deficient)
Purpura not due to low platelet count
Medical Function: Improves cAMP
Calms the central nervous system
Inhibits histamine, IgE, and 5-HT (serotonin)
Protects liver
Improves strength of muscles
Inhibits cell mutation and inhibits cancer cells
Treating skin cancer
The active ingredients betulinic acid and maslinic acid possess the effect of inhibiting cancer cells
Preventing reaction in blood transfusion
The flavonoids of the pits possess strong anti radical effect [1]
Increases the muscle strength
Da zao can increase the amount of monocytes in the body
Can improve the function of mononuclear phagocyte system, protect the liver, improve the strength of the body
Da zao can increase the oxygen content of the body, nourish the cells
It is a mild tonic
The effective ingredients are the same as those in the seed which possess the sedative, hypnotic and antihypertensive effect

Liver protective effect: In study of the liver of rabbits that have been injured by CCl4, the total serum protein obviously was higher than those of control group, after feed the decoction of da zao continuously for one week
Anti-cancer, anti-mutation: it inhibits the multiplying of cancer cells of mice
Increases muscle strength: after continuously feeding the decoction for 3 weeks, the body weight of mice, compared to control group, increased and the swimming time increased
Da zao can improve the function of mononuclear phagocyte system, protect the liver, improve the strength of body
Da zao can make the blood oxygen content increase, nourish all body cells, is a mild tonic

Da zao contains abundant cAMP-like substances, after oral administration, the cAMP content of peripheral blood plasma and leukocytes obviously increases, the cAMP/cGMP ratio rises, which is the pharmacological mechanism for da zao's anti-allergic effect

After taking formulas containing da zao, such as Ge Gen Tang (kudzu/tangerine decoction), Mai Men Dong Tang (ophiopogon decoction), Xiao Chai Hu Tang (minor bupleurum decoction), the cAMP content in peripheral white blood cells is 10~15 times higher than the control group; if da zao is removed, this effect is absent; the cAMP/cGMP ratio of asthmatic patients is lower than normal, after taking Xiao Qing Long Tang (minor green dragon decoction) with da zao, the ratio increases, leading to bronchodilation and relief of asthma
Ethanol extract of da zao can inhibit antibody production in rats with anti-isoantibody as the indicator; 100mg action intensity is equivalent to 5~10mg of Imuran (azathioprine)

Promotes growth, enhances vigor and protects the liver: After oral intake of da zao decoction in mice for three weeks, body weight increased, physical strength enhanced (swimming time prolonged); for rabbits with carbon tetrachloride-induced liver injury, the total serum protein and albumin quantities were evidently increased over the control group
Samples of Formulae: gan mai da zao tang (甘麥大棗湯, licorice wheat and jujube decoction), gui pi tang (歸脾湯, restore spleen decoction), ge gen tang (葛根湯, kudzu decoction), gui zhi tang (桂枝湯, cinnamon twig decoction), xing su san (杏蘇散, apricot kernel and perilla leaf powder)
Contraindications:
Da zao promotes damp heat (infection of the digestive tract). It creates flatulence, indigestion, promotes parasites, bad teeth. Do not use in case of heat type of cough or in case of yeast infection.

Do not use large amount in cases of pixu (spleen deficient) and digestion is weak.

According to the Whole Nation of Japan Farmers' Federation, the five kinds of Chinese herb being sold in the market—chen pi (tangerine peel), su ye (perilla leaf), da zao (jujube), jie shi (tangerine fruit), shan zhu yu (cornelian cherry)—have been tested and showed they contain farm chemical residues. Although there is a suspicion of conflict of interest, the credibility is high. It is better to soak the herb in water and wash it thoroughly before use.

大棗助濕熱，令人中滿。故濕盛，脘腹脹滿，食積，蟲積，齲齒作痛，以及痰熱咳嗽或帶下者均忌服。 脾虛消化不良者，不可服用太多。
Research:
CNS sedative effect: its effective ingredients are the same as those in the seed which possess the sedative, hypnotic and antihypertensive effect.

Liver protective effect: In study of the liver of rabbits that have been injured by CCl4. The total serum protein obviously was higher than those of control group, after feed the decoction of da zao continuously for one week.

Anti-cancer, anti-mutation: it inhibits the multiplying of cancer cells of mice.

Increases the muscle strength: after continuously feeding the decoction for 3 weeks, the body weight of mice, compared to control group, increased and the swimming time increased.

Da zao can increase the amount of monocytes in the body: can improve the function of mononuclear phagocyte system, protect the liver, improve the strength of the body.

Da zao can increase the oxygen content of the body, nourish the cells. It is a mild tonic.

Da zao contains abundant cAMP-like substances, after oral administration, the cAMP content of peripheral blood plasma and leukocytes obviously increases, the cAMP/cGMP ratio rises; administration of formulas with da zao, such as Ge Gen Tang (kudzu/tangerine decoction), Mai Men Dong Tang (ophiopogon decoction), Xiao Chai Hu Tang (minor bupleurum decoction) increases the cAMP content in peripheral leukocyte cells by 10~15 times compared to control group; removal of da zao from the formula abolishes this effect. In asthma patients, leukocyte cAMP/cGMP ratio is lower than normal, addition of da zao to Xiao Qing Long Tang (minor green dragon decoction) increases the ratio, leading to bronchodilation and asthma relief.

Ethanol extract of da zao can inhibit antibody production in rats, with 100mg having action equivalent to 5~10mg of Imuran (azathioprine).

After oral administration of da zao decoction in mice for 3 weeks, body weight increased, strength enhanced (swimming time prolonged). For rabbits with CCl4-induced liver injury, total serum protein and albumin increased significantly as compared to controls.

Source: http://www.dharma.com.tw/x2gb/d32health/H417WellSupply10.htm
Notes:
Da zao are black in color and hong zao are smaller and red in color. Both are from the same kind of fruit. When the fruit are blanched slightly in boiling water, and dried under the sun, they are called hong zao (red jujube). Da zao are the hong zao that has been cooked with cotton seed oil mixed with pine smoke water solution and smoked dry.

The pits contain flavonoids that possess a very strong scavenging effect on DPPH free radicals [1].

In popular belief, the pits promote heat and frequently are removed before using. The editor has not found any classical Chinese medical literature mentioning that the pits are hot in characteristic.

註：紅棗為新鲜棗果直接晒乾而成的。大棗（黑棗）為紅棗在棉子油，松煙水中煮熟，再用煙火熏烤成的。棗核含類黄酮對DPPH自由基有很强的清除活性[1]。民間認為棗核性熱。常將棗核除去。編者沒看到有中醫古典書籍提到棗核性熱。

Rutein: Rutein content can be as high as 3385mg/100g
Sugar: Sugar content in fresh da zao can be higher than 40%, mainly glucose
Vitamins: Vitamin C in fresh da zao can be higher than 540~972mg/100g

Maladies Treated: Bruises and hematoma caused by impact injuries
Bruises and hematoma: fresh xiang mao 40-60 grams boiled with water and taken orally
Medical Function: The essential oil of xiang mao possesses antifungal effect (like Venezuelan Streptomyces kitasatoensis)

Leaves and roots contain an insulin-like substance that possesses hypoglycemic and hypolipidemic effects. This insulin-like substance is a grey white powder, non flagrant, slightly bitter, non-alkaloid, non-glucoside, and non-tannin. Its insulin value is 1 gram equals to 440 units (oral), or 880 units (hypodermic injection).
Citral possesses anti-cancer effect.
Citronellal and geraniol possess fragrant smell and can be used as spices but are not known to possess any medical uses.

A chemical structurally similar to citral, 'xiang mao acid', when injected subcutaneously in mice, has a paralytic effect; on isolated toad heart it has a positive inotropic (cardiotonic) effect, but large doses can cause systolic arrest; injection in rabbits causes blood pressure to drop and respiration to increase; perfusion of toad hind limbs causes vasodilatation; on isolated rabbit intestinal specimens, it inhibits smooth muscle; in rabbits it has a hemolytic effect.
Dosage:
Fresh herb: 10-15 grams.
Dry herb: 3-6 grams for decoction.
Essential oil: a few drops.

Headache due to cold: fresh xiang mao (lemon grass) 40 grams, boiled with water and taken orally.
Bruises and hematoma: fresh xiang mao (lemon grass) 40-60 grams boiled with water and taken orally.

Research:

There are reports that the leaves and roots contain an insulin like substance that possesses hypoglycemic and hypolipidemic effects. Its insulin value is 1 gram equals to 440 units (oral), or 880 units (hypodermic injection).

Notes: Fresh xiang mao (lemon grass) is not sold in Chinese herb stores but can be found in Vietnamese/Chinese markets or East Indian markets in America. Sometimes it can be found in Super Markets in California. It is sold in market places in South East Asia.

Prevention of enterovirus formula (彰化秀傳醫院):
Composition: yiyiren (coix seed) 1 liang, huashi (talcum) 6 qian, ma chi xian (purslane) 3 qian, banlangen (isatis root) 3 qian, baimaogen (imperata root) 3 qian, sheng gancao (raw licorice root) 2 qian, dazao (jujube) 1 qian, bohe (peppermint / field mint) 0.5 qian (add when nearly cooked). Add 1000 ml water (one large mineral water bottle), bring to boil on high heat, then add rock sugar to taste, simmer on low heat for 30 minutes. For under one year old: 3 ml (about half a tablespoon); one to two years: 5 ml; two to three years: 7 ml; three to four years: 9 ml, etc. For those sixteen or older, it may be drunk as regular water.
Note: Those with weak constitutions may develop diarrhea (the herb is cold in property); should reduce dosage or eat apples to ameliorate. Do not leave the medicine overnight. In this formula, banlangen (isatis root) and ma chi xian (purslane) contribute the most to infection prevention; baimaogen (imperata root) is most significant for fever reduction. Editor's note: Adding sugar may not be suitable as sugar can promote fluid movement into the intestines and increase diarrhea.

This plant is both herb and vegetable, non-toxic and has anti-cancer properties. In folk practice, it is used for upset stomach, diarrhea and other digestive issues, with effects as good as western medicine. If western medicine is not available, this can be used in emergency. In wilderness survival, it is important to know and use it.

    馬齒莧的好處在大陸版「抗癌中草藥」一書如此描述：「全草含去甲基腎上腺素〈noradrenaline〉和多量鉀鹽•有治療腫瘤的作用。由於含豐富維生素A樣物質，故能促進上皮細胞的生理功能趨於正常，並能促進潰瘍的癒合。對痢疾桿菌﹐大腸桿菌﹐傷寒桿菌及常見致病性皮膚真菌均有抑制作用。」

    這個看來既藥既菜的植物，既無毒又有防癌功能，何嚐不可？而在民間習慣上，是使用於吃壞肚子﹐下痢等症，效果不輸西藥，臨時抓不到西藥，可用這個應急。野外求生，當然也要會認而用之。

    另彰化秀傳醫院公開的預防腸病毒方，即含有馬齒莧一方，抄錄供參考如下：「薏苡仁一兩﹐滑石六錢﹐馬齒莧三錢﹐板藍根三錢﹐白茅根三錢﹐生甘草二錢﹐大棗一錢﹐薄荷五分〈快煮好時再下〉」，加清水一千毫升〈按，一瓶大礦泉水〉，以大火煮沸後加冰糖適量，改轉小火熬三○分鐘。一歲以下三毫升〈按，約半湯匙〉；一至二歲五毫升；二至三歲七毫升；三至四歲九毫升，依此類推，十六歲以上則可當開水喝。

    虛弱體質可能有腹瀉作用〈按，本劑性冷〉，須減量或另食蘋果改善。藥劑不可隔夜。 」。以上藥方中，板藍根及馬齒莧對感染症貢獻較大；白茅根則在退燒方面較顯著。
編者按﹕加糖可能不適合﹐因為糖能促進組織內的液體進入大腸內而增加腹瀉。
